oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alberta Survey, 2015A
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Population Research Laboratory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Population Research Laboratory (PRL) administered the 2015 Alberta Survey A. This survey of households across the province of Alberta continues to enable academic researchers, government departments, and non-profit organizations to explore a wide range of topics in a structured research framework and environment. Sponsors’ research questions are asked together with demographic questions in a telephone interview of Alberta households.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: household composition
age
gender
marital status
highest level of education
household income
religion
ethnic background
place of birth
employment status
number of paid jobs
total hours worked per week
home ownership
political party support
voting behaviour
perceptions of financial status
physical activity
China’s role in Alberta’s economy
public health and injuries
climate dialogue
family dynamics
